This is stated in a negative way to emphasize the slaughter. It can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "let us kill every one of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: let us not leave one of them alive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This negative statement emphasizes the completeness of the destruction. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])

This is stated as a negative to emphasize that God tells the truth. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "will always tell the truth and do what he says" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: will not lie nor change his mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is stated as a negative to emphasize that God is trustworthy. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "he is God, and will do what he says he will do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: he is not a man, that he should change his mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: David is pointing out how he and his men offered protection to Nabal's servants and flocks. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "we kept them and all their property from harm" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: we did them no harm, and they missed nothing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated positively and in active form. Alternate translation: "he still has everything that was his" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing was missed of all that belonged to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Abigail is stating that if David chooses not to take revenge he will have a clear conscience when Yahweh makes him king of Israel. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "You will always be glad you acted as you did-that you have not poured out innocent blood, or because my master did not attempt to rescue himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "I know of nothing that he has done wrong" or "I am very pleased with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: I have found no fault with him
